title.narrative: IR 5.3 RESILIENCE DS LES ZONES TRANSIT

description.narrative: IR5.3Â : Community resilience and social actors in the transitional areas is increased through sustainable increase in access to basic social services and capacity-building of community structures to manage conflict-related risks., which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection And Emergencies, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Health And Emergencies, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESSPCR 5: By the end of 2018, the most vulnerable children and their families, crises' victimes, have received timely and effective assistance those in post- crisis situations have benefited from improved and equitable access to social services and peaceful conflict mediation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR5.3 : Community resilience and social actors in the transitional areas is increased through sustainable increase in access tobasic social services and capacity-building of community structures to manage conflict-related risks.

description.narrative: In 2019, the Participatory Empowering Approaches for Resilience (PEAR III) programme provided 256,000 people with a protective environment for children by improving access to social services in order to promote reconciliation between communities in conflict and community-based resilience. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: of communities that have received support from UNICEF to improve their access to essential social services AND to build their capacity to manage the risks associated with the conflict.[ de communautes qui ont recu un appui d'UNICEF pour ameliorer leur acces aux services sociaux de base ET pour renforcer leur capacite a gerer les risques associes au conflit. ](49867)

actual.value: 2019:In the PTA 2019, the indicator is the number of people reached with a multisectoral response through the PEAR+Target: 800,000 (400,000 NK, 400,000 Ituri)Results : 256,000
